meanings.definition: To cover or hide with a screen.
meanings.sent1: She bescreened the window to keep the sunlight out.
meanings.sent2: The phone was bescreened with a protective cover.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat bescreened itself behind the curtains, playing hide and seek.
meanings.sent4: His emotions were bescreened by a mask of indifference.
meanings.sent5: The forest was bescreened by a thick fog, creating an eerie atmosphere.

meanings.definition: To provide with a screen or screens.
meanings.sent1: The company bescreened all the computers to prevent unauthorized access.
meanings.sent2: The event organizers bescreened the stage for the upcoming performance.
meanings.sent3: The chef bescreened the cooking area to avoid splatters while preparing the dish.
meanings.sent4: The security team bescreened the entrance with metal detectors for safety checks.
meanings.sent5: The artist bescreened the gallery walls with beautiful paintings for the exhibition.
